result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luz Eneida Cruz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luz Eneida Cruz appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Luz Eneida Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Calendar call held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Court cancels the stayed bench warrant. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luz Eneida Cruz not in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Luz Eneida Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a pre-trial conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Calendar call scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report Report 10-04-2022, filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
MAP-M
CM
MJP-T
JMF. 
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Luz Eneida Cruz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Luz Eneida Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that due to the intake calendar of the week, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
